rules.text: This is the short version of our rules, please read the full text on https://strangeobject.space/about/
We do not tolerate oppression of people on the basis of who they are.
Bots are generally not allowed on this instance. Exceptions must be explicitly allowed by the admins of the instance.
Organizations and institutions should generally not have accounts on strangeobject.space. Exceptions are possible but rare and need to be decided on by the moderators/admins.
Use descriptions for visual media on public timeline posts.
Sexual, erotic, kinky and sex-work related content is explicitly allowed as long as it's not illegal in Germany.
Use content warnings and sensitive media markers where appropriate (see above for details).
Provide attribution for creative works, memes or citations of popular media are excempt from this rule.
We don't tolerate promotion of any cryptocurrency, NFTs, de-fi, and related projects.
Severe or repeated violations can lead to freezing, limiting and suspending of a user's account.
Members must be 18 years old or older.

records.text: In the building next to mine there is an organisation that's usually silent enough (with some occasional music) but this week they're having festival week with workshops and partners and music and parties and guests and aperos and free podiums and everything. So that was the final drop earlier today causing my bad mood. Yesterday evening I had to wait to go to sleep - they announced to stop at 11, which they did, but I was tired earlier. And then at noon today it started again already. So I was completely overwhelmed by their noise. I forced myself to walk to the park, even though I felt like I should rest today. And the exact same course of events might happen this evening through tomorrow afternoon and tomorrow evening. Then it's over, fortunately.

records.text: Then Dachau. Opened already in 1933 as a camp for forced labour. This sentence: Representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross inspected the camp in 1935 and 1938 and documented the harsh conditions.I just can't help but immediately think of what's happening currently, with the UN and its resolutions, the Red Cross and their reports, the ICJ and their entire case to prove that there's a genocide going on. Before Auschwitz I was even built, the camp at Dachau had been condemned. But it all continued, for years, and for millions of murders.

records.text: Reading about the history of Munchen and Dachau preparing for my upcoming trip is extra painful given the current state of the world.Copied from wikipedia: In 1923 Gustav von Kahr was appointed Bavarian prime minister and immediately planned for the expulsion of all Jews who did not hold German citizenship. Chief of Police Ernst Pöhner and Wilhelm Frick openly indulged in antisemitism, while Bavarian judges praised people on the political right as patriotic for their crimes and handed down mild sentences.In 1923. 1923. That is 20 years before 1943. I mean I know of course that antisemitism existed already. It's just so fucking painful to see we're doing the exact same thing. In 2014 Wilders went "do you want more or less Moroccans?" and the crowd chanted "less! less! less!" Ten years later, in 2023, his party won the elections. And that's just one event in one country. What the fuck what the fuck what the fuck

records.text: In the building next to mine there is an organisation that's usually silent enough (with some occasional music) but this week they're having festival week with workshops and partners and music and parties and guests and aperos and free podiums and everything. So that was the final drop earlier today causing my bad mood. Yesterday evening I had to wait to go to sleep - they announced to stop at 11, which they did, but I was tired earlier. And then at noon today it started again already. So I was completely overwhelmed by their noise. I forced myself to walk to the park, even though I felt like I should rest today. And the exact same course of events might happen this evening through tomorrow afternoon and tomorrow evening. Then it's over, fortunately.

records.text: Reading about the history of Munchen and Dachau preparing for my upcoming trip is extra painful given the current state of the world.Copied from wikipedia: In 1923 Gustav von Kahr was appointed Bavarian prime minister and immediately planned for the expulsion of all Jews who did not hold German citizenship. In 2014 Wilders went "do you want more or less Moroccans?" and the crowd chanted "less! less! less!" Ten years later, in 2023, his party won the elections. And that's just one event in one country. What the fuck what the fuck what the fuck

records.text: In the building next to mine there is an organisation that's usually silent enough (with some occasional music) but this week they're having festival week with workshops and partners and music and parties and guests and aperos and free podiums and everything. So that was the final drop earlier today causing my bad mood. Yesterday evening I had to wait to go to sleep - they announced to stop at 11, which they did, but I was tired earlier. And then at noon today it started again already. So I was completely overwhelmed by their noise. I forced myself to walk to the park, even though I felt like I should rest today. And the exact same course of events might happen this evening through tomorrow afternoon and tomorrow evening. Then it's over, fortunately.

records.text: Reading about the history of Munchen and Dachau preparing for my upcoming trip is extra painful given the current state of the world.Copied from wikipedia: In 1923 Gustav von Kahr was appointed Bavarian prime minister and immediately planned for the expulsion of all Jews who did not hold German citizenship. Chief of Police Ernst Pöhner and Wilhelm Frick openly indulged in antisemitism, while Bavarian judges praised people on the political right as patriotic for their crimes and handed down mild sentences.In 1923. 1923. That is 20 years before 1943. I mean I know of course that antisemitism existed already. It's just so fucking painful to see we're doing the exact same thing. In 2014 Wilders went "do you want more or less Moroccans?" and the crowd chanted "less! less! less!" Ten years later, in 2023, his party won the elections. And that's just one event in one country. What the fuck what the fuck what the fuck

records.text: In the building next to mine there is an organisation that's usually silent enough (with some occasional music) but this week they're having festival week with workshops and partners and music and parties and guests and aperos and free podiums and everything. So that was the final drop earlier today causing my bad mood. Yesterday evening I had to wait to go to sleep - they announced to stop at 11, which they did, but I was tired earlier. And then at noon today it started again already. So I was completely overwhelmed by their noise. I forced myself to walk to the park, even though I felt like I should rest today. And the exact same course of events might happen this evening through tomorrow afternoon and tomorrow evening. Then it's over, fortunately.

This sentence: Representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross inspected the camp in 1935 and 1938 and documented the harsh conditions.I just can't help but immediately think of what's happening currently, with the UN and its resolutions, the Red Cross and their reports, the ICJ and their entire case to prove that there's a genocide going on. records.text: Reading about the history of Munchen and Dachau preparing for my upcoming trip is extra painful given the current state of the world.Copied from wikipedia: In 1923 Gustav von Kahr was appointed Bavarian prime minister and immediately planned for the expulsion of all Jews who did not hold German citizenship. Chief of Police Ernst Pöhner and Wilhelm Frick openly indulged in antisemitism, while Bavarian judges praised people on the political right as patriotic for their crimes and handed down mild sentences.In 1923. 1923. That is 20 years before 1943. I mean I know of course that antisemitism existed already. It's just so fucking painful to see we're doing the exact same thing. In 2014 Wilders went "do you want more or less Moroccans?" and the crowd chanted "less! less! less!" Ten years later, in 2023, his party won the elections. And that's just one event in one country. What the fuck what the fuck what the fuck
